headline: Apple sued by authors over use of books in AI training
summary: (Reuters) -Technology giant Apple was accused by authors in a lawsuit on Friday of illegally using their copyrighted books to help train its artificial intelligence systems, part of an expanding legal fight over protections for intellectual property in the AI era.  The proposed class action, filed in the federal court in Northern California, said Apple copied protected works without consent and without credit or compensation.  “Apple has not attempted to pay these authors for their contributions to this potentially lucrative venture,” according to the lawsuit, filed by authors Grady Hendrix and Jennifer Roberson.

raw.headline: Apple sued by authors over use of books in AI training
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Technology giant Apple was accused by authors in a lawsuit on Friday of illegally using their copyrighted books to help train its artificial intelligence systems, part of an expanding legal fight over protections for intellectual property in the AI era.  The proposed class action, filed in the federal court in Northern California, said Apple copied protected works without consent and without credit or compensation.  “Apple has not attempted to pay these authors for their contributions to this potentially lucrative venture,” according to the lawsuit, filed by authors Grady Hendrix and Jennifer Roberson.

headline: Trump warns Big Tech CEOs of 'substantial' tariffs at WH dinner
summary: Big Tech executives continue cozying up to President Trump, with Meta (META) CEO Mark Zuckerberg, OpenAI (OPAI.PVT) CEO Sam Altman, and Apple (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook having attended a White House dinner on Thursday. Trump warned of "substantial" tariffs on semiconductors at the dinner. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley examines the tech executives' ongoing diplomacy efforts with the Trump administration. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Alphabet Within Striking Range of $3 Trillion as Key Risk Clears
summary: The decision by a US district court judge Tuesday enabled Google’s parent to avoid the most punitive measures sought by regulators, including the sale of its Chrome browser.  With the case now out of the way, investors are turning their attention back to the potential for gains in Alphabet’s stock, which is the cheapest among the Magnificent Seven despite the recent rally.  “What it does is it clears the runway for additional growth opportunities,” said Neville Javeri, senior fund manager at Allspring Global Investments, referring to the ruling.

raw.headline: Alphabet Within Striking Range of $3 Trillion as Key Risk Clears
raw.summary: The decision by a US district court judge Tuesday enabled Google’s parent to avoid the most punitive measures sought by regulators, including the sale of its Chrome browser.  With the case now out of the way, investors are turning their attention back to the potential for gains in Alphabet’s stock, which is the cheapest among the Magnificent Seven despite the recent rally.  “What it does is it clears the runway for additional growth opportunities,” said Neville Javeri, senior fund manager at Allspring Global Investments, referring to the ruling.

headline: UGREEN Launches New MagFlow Qi2 25W Lineup, Pioneering a New Era of Faster Magnetic Charging
summary: UGREEN, a leading global consumer electronics brand, today announced its next-generation MagFlow Series of magnetic wireless chargers with Qi2 25W support. Engineered for the latest open standard, the lineup delivers fast wireless charging with precise magnetic alignment. These new chargers offer seamless compatibility across both Apple and Android devices, including the newly released Google Pixel 10 Pro XL or iPhone 16 series using newer iOS 26, and the upcoming iPhone 17 series.

headline: Apple’s India Sales Hit Record $9 Billion After Big Retail Push
summary: Apple Inc.’s annual sales in India hit a record of nearly $9 billion in the last fiscal year, signaling growing consumer demand for its flagship devices as the company ramps up its retail footprint in the world’s most populous country.  Apple’s marquee iPhones accounted for a majority of the sales, and demand for MacBook computers also surged.  While India represents still a fraction of its overall business, the company is investing in a country it expects to become a key market in coming years.

headline: Apple’s Chairman of the Board Sold More Than $20 Million in Stock
summary: The chairman of  Apple’s  board sold more than $20 million of common stock late last month, filings show.  A Form 4 filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday shows Arthur Levinson sold 90,000 Apple shares on Aug. 28 on the open market at prices ranging from $231.815 to $232.36.  A separate document shows Levinson purchased the shares on Feb. 27, 2001, when they were worth around 29 cents each.

raw.headline: Apple’s Chairman of the Board Sold More Than $20 Million in Stock

A Form 4 filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday shows Arthur Levinson sold 90,000 Apple shares on Aug. 28 on the open market at prices ranging from $231.815 to $232.36.  A separate document shows Levinson purchased the shares on Feb. 27, 2001, when they were worth around 29 cents each.

headline: Trump to impose tariffs on semiconductor imports from firms not moving production to US
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -President Donald Trump said on Thursday his administration would impose tariffs on semiconductor imports from companies not shifting production to the U.S., speaking ahead of a dinner with major technology company CEOs.  Since returning to office in January, Trump's threat of tariffs has alienated trading partners, stirred volatility in financial markets and fueled global economic uncertainty.  Chips and semiconductors - we will be putting tariffs on companies that aren't coming in.
